title: [SPIKE] Error and data handling inside new architecture modularization
body:
This spike is intended to get a clearer idea about error handling integrations through all modules inside the app. 

Goals:

- Check if exceptions are the best way to handle errors in every layer
- How to escalate errors to the upper layers

-------------------
Edited by @davigonz: 

Some considerations after checking the code:
- `RemoteOperationResult` object will not longer appear above data layer, the remote datasources will retrieve data or throw new exceptions to upper layers.
- These new exceptions will be encapsulated in a `UseCaseResult` object in domain layer.
- Datasources should retrieve domain model objects, transforming them from data model objects. Example: Data layer working with `ShareEntity` and transforming it to `Share` before pushing it to upper layers. WE CAN NOT APPLY THESE CHANGES YET, FIRST WE NEED TO DECOUPLE A BIT MORE THE LAYERS.
- ViewModels will handle `UseCaseResult` objects and transform the information contained there in new `UIResult` objects.

title: [BUG] Copying/moving files to ownCloud through document provider does not work if app folders are not created
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Files are not copied/moved to ownCloud.

### Expected behaviour
- Files are properly copied/moved to ownCloud.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Remove all the folders related to ownCloud from your internal storage.
2. Install ownCloud app.
3. Open Files/Downloads app.
4. Select a bunch of files from internal storage or Images section.
5. Tap three dots button and select copy or move to an ownCloud account.


### Environment data
Android version: 8.1.0

Device model: Nexus 5X

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 2.12

#### Android logs
```
2019-09-18 13:40:01.584 24792-24855/com.owncloud.android.debug E/DatabaseUtils: Writing exception to parcel
    android.os.ParcelableException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: File -1 not found
        at android.provider.DocumentsProvider.call(DocumentsProvider.java:951)
        at android.content.ContentProvider$Transport.call(ContentProvider.java:401)
        at android.content.ContentProviderNative.onTransact(ContentProviderNative.java:272)
        at android.os.Binder.execTransact(Binder.java:697)
     Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: File -1 not found
        at com.owncloud.android.providers.DocumentsStorageProvider.getFileByIdOrException(DocumentsStorageProvider.kt:516)
        at com.owncloud.android.providers.DocumentsStorageProvider.deleteDocument(DocumentsStorageProvider.kt:332)
        at android.provider.DocumentsProvider.callUnchecked(DocumentsProvider.java:1046)
        at android.provider.DocumentsProvider.call(DocumentsProvider.java:949)
        at android.content.ContentProvider$Transport.call(ContentProvider.java:401) 
        at android.content.ContentProviderNative.onTransact(ContentProviderNative.java:272) 
        at android.os.Binder.execTransact(Binder.java:697) 
```

The cause of this problem is that the document providers needs to have a temporal folder in external storage to copy/move files and that folder is not currently created till we download something from the ownCloud app.

title: [BUG] OAuth2 token is not renewed after being revoked
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Start an OAuth2 session
2. After some minutes and correct renewals, open webUI -> Settings -> Security, and revoke the Android session
3. In the app, session finishes, displaying a Snackbar "Authentication Failed".  Open "Manage accounts", tap on key icon to re-authenticate.
4. Reauthentication

### Actual behaviour
From this point, the app is not automatically renewed anymore. Once the token expires, regular 401 is received 

`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<d:error xmlns:d="DAV:" xmlns:s="http://sabredav.org/ns">
  <s:exception>Sabre\DAV\Exception\NotAuthenticated</s:exception>
  <s:message>No public access to this resource., No 'Authorization: Basic' header found. Either the client didn't send one, or the server is misconfigured, Bearer token was incorrect, No 'Authorization: Basic' header found. Either the client
didn't send one, or the server is misconfigured</s:message>
</d:error>`

but no POST to renew

### Expected behaviour
POST sent to renew

Samsung S9 v9
NExus 5X v8

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Scratch set up for Settings
body:
Related to https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2638

In the Settings view should be always accesible, there are some regards:

- If no accounts are attached: instant uploads must be disabled/hidden
- Security settings: no changes
- More section: no changes

For this reason, the main target here should be:

- Disabling (not posible to click) instant uploads form scratch till a first account is attached
- Disabling instant uploads, if they were enabled before and the only account in device was removed.

title: [BUG] URL of old servers (not supported) shows an non-accurate error message
body:
Server versions older than 9.1 are not supported since the Android app has moved to the new webDAV endpoints. For this reason, it is not posible to login in these older versions anymore.

If you try to login, the error is:

`Local copy not be renamed; try a different name`

Error message should show the correct situation, f. ex. :

`Server version not supported anymore, please move to a newer one`

or similar one.

Login feature in new architecture (#2608) is a good candidate for doing that change

title: [New arch] Unravel ownCloud Client + ownCloud Account mess (Session handling)
body:
The owncloud clients are objects used by the library to execute remote operations and contain credentials. These objects would be pretty easy to maintain if it weren't for the multiaccount support, which forces us to have a dependency between accounts and clients, reusing clients for an account.

Nowadays the creation of ownCloud Client is handled by different classes:
- OwnCloudClientFactory
- OwnCloudClientManagerFactory
- OwnCloudClientManager
- SimpleFactoryManager
- SingleSessionManager
- DynamicSessionManager

Thanks to [Get rid of saml implementation issue](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2632) , we could:
- Get rid of `SINGLE_SESSION_PER_ACCOUNT` case in _OwnCloudClientManagerFactory_.

Thanks to https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2636, we could:
- Get rid of `SINGLE_SESSION_PER_ACCOUNT_IF_SERVER_SUPPORTS_SERVER_MONITORING` case in _OwnCloudClientManagerFactory_ since server monitoring is supported by default on >=10 servers. Therefore, _DynamicSessionManager_ would be no longer needed.

Once we clean up the way to handle ownCloud Clients we could create a factory of clients from accounts by using dependency injection with Koin (https://insert-koin.io/docs/2.0/documentation/reference/index.html#_declaring_injection_parameters)

title: [New arch] Login arch: check URL, check credentials and get user info (basic auth)
body:
The steps in the login process are: 

1. _FileDisplayActivity_ is created.
2. `addAccount(...)` method from _AccountAuthenticator_ is called, which starts _AuthenticatorActivity_.
3. User introduces username and password and press login button.
4. _AuthenticatorAsyncTask_ creates two clients (with no accounts) using `OwnCloudClientFactory.createOwnCloudClient(...)` and perform _ExistenceCheckRemoteOperation_ and _GetRemoteUserInfoOperation_
5. _AuthenticatorActivity_ waits for _AuthenticatorAsyncTask_ response and creates an _Account_ explicitly using _AccountManager_ if everything worked fine.

### TASKS

- [x] Create branch new_arch/2634-basic_auth
- [x] Development tasks
  - [x] Create domain model
       - [x] UserInfo
       - [x] ServerInfo
       - [x] AuthenticationMethod (enum)
  - [x] Create usecases
       - [x] getServerInfo
       - [x] login
       - [x] getUserInfo
  - [x] Create repositories
       - [x] UserRepository
       - [x] ServerRepository
  - [x] Create datasources (remote or local - pending to check)
       - [x] User (Remote)
       - [x] Server (Remote)
  - [x] Save data retrieved for operations (Not needed)
  - [x] Use dependency injection to obtain simple ownCloud clients via new ownCloudClients factory, without considering ownCloud accounts for now. (maybe done, will check)
- [x] Error handling
- [x] Add units tests (instrumented and not instrumented)
- [x] Code review and apply changes requested
- [x] Tests passing

title: Add tests to fix corner cases in sharing.
[BUG] Changing the account does not work properly in some cases
body:
### Actual behaviour
Having an issue when two accounts have been added into the application that are hosted on the same server and you switch between them.

Often when switching between accounts, the application gets confused and in the end it will only show content from one of the accounts even if you switch to the other. When it happens the "manage accounts" shows the confusion, with the bold username being the same for both accounts, with only the username@domain differing. Depending on which account you're on, you could get stuck on either one (only been using two accounts for the moment). 

When it happens closing the application (and removing it from the running list) doesn't resolve the issue, only restarting the phone.

### Expected behaviour
The account is switched properly. I see only the content from the selected account.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create two accounts on the same server
2. Add different content
3. Add these two accounts to the app
3. Switch between the accounts

### Environment data
Android version:
8.0.0
Device model: 
Samsung S7
ownCloud app version:
2.11.1
ownCloud server version:
10.2.0.5

title: [New arch] Modularization, decoupling and new error handling
body:
Specific issue to start modularizing the app, following the guidelines defined in #2351 

- Tasks
    - [x] Split up code into different modules following a layers approach and move the corresponding shares code to those modules:
        - Presentation layer => **owncloudApp** module
        - Domain layer => **owncloudDomain** module
        - Data layer => **owncloudData** module
    - [x] Use mockk instead of mockito in UI and domain unit tests, more prepared to work with Kotlin instead of Java.
    - [x] Transform sharing operations into usecases in domain model.
    - [x] Decouple data and domain modules with the help of dependency injection (Koin). Domain should not depend on data layer directly => Difficult to achieve due to strong ownCloud Client dependencies that force us to use instances of repositories in domain layer when we should use repository interfaces.
    - [x] Create share data and domain models with some Mapper classes to transform them.
    - [x] Create capability data and domain models with some Mapper classes to transform them.
    - [x] Error handling, + info in https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2665
    - [x] Create new services as facade for remote operations to decouple that logic from remote datasources and ease remote datasource and repository tests
    - [x] Fix already existing tests: unit and UI. Use corresponding share models in TestUtils.
      - [x] Data layer
         - [x] Datasources
         - [x] Repositories
         - [x] Mappers (model-entities, model-remote)
         - [x] Entity
         - [x] DAOs
      - [x] Domain layer
         - [x] Usecases
      - [x] Presentation layer 
         - [x] ViewModel Tests
         - [x] UI tests
    - [x] New tests for usecases
    - [x] New tests for models
    - [ ] Use StandAloneContext.loadKoinModules. See https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2603#discussion_r303351786

### PRs
   - App: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2707
   - Library: https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/278

#### Pending issues (create  separate ones?)
- Consider adding a new module just for data testing. 
- Consider renaming usecases to Fetch...() instead of Refresh...FromServer()

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Permission UI handling
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Permissions can not be increased when content is reshared. In case of a shared folder, all its contents must "inherit" the parent folder permissions. 

Currently in Android app, by following these steps:

- User1 shares a folder with User2, granting "share" and "create" permission and revoking "update" and "delete" permissions
- User2 reshares with User3

the current behaviour is:

- By default, shares are created with all permissions granted. To revoke permissions, share must be edited.
- Share from User2 to User3 does not grant any permission by default (only read permission)
- User2 edits his Share with User3. Everything is disabled. If User2 ticks "share" and "create" everything is OK (these are the permissions granted by User1). If User2 ticks "update" or "delete", a snackbar error message is displayed because the permissions are not granted by User1

**Describe the solution you'd like**

> - By default, shares are created with all permissions granted. To revoke permissions, share must be edited.

when a sharee is selected from the list of matches, list of permissions is displayed to be selected by the user to grant the sharee. Permissions by default are ticked/unticked depending values of capability "default_permissions"

> - User3 does not have any permission by default (only read permission)
> - User3 can tick all the permissions. If that permission is not granted, an alert is shown

Only displayed "create" and "share". "Update" and "delete" are hidden or greyed out. 

### TASKS

- [ ] Research (if needed)
- [ ] Create branch feature/feature_name
- [ ] Development tasks
  - [ ] Implement whatever
  - [ ] ...
- [ ] Code review and apply changes requested
- [ ] Design test plan

title: [BUG] Ocasional crashes in av. offline folders with many items
body:
There are not specific steps to reproduce, i will detail the process i did:

1. I have a folder called "Documents" in root. It contains 250 small txt files (~1 KB each)
2. Set the "Documents" folder as available offline. Everything inside the folder is dowloaded and marked as av. offline

From this point, if you browse inside the folder and then browse back to root, the folder is synced (it is av. offline, therefore always synced). By repeating this process several times (no more than 3 - 4), the app finally crashes

title: CameraUpload no longer works
body:
"Version 2.11.0-beta.1 release f280dd0a5" on a Samsung S4 with Android 5.0.1

When enabling Camer-Upload, I get a requester:
![Screenshot_2019-06-11-14-28-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1108546/59279813-e64dfe00-8c64-11e9-84c4-481629f44597.png)


a) It asks the user to find the folder where the camera stores images. Please add some instructions how to find that folder. This is a tedious thing to do manually, no other app ever asked me this. The "Camera-Folder (Optional)" is /storage/emulated/0/DCIM/Camera which is some default or inherited?

b) The Camera-Folder is flagged "Optional", which contradicts the warning It should says "Important" instead of optional.

c) The requester says, uploads are now delayed 15 Minutes. This makes the CameraUpload mostly useless. Uploading manually is now usually faster. 

I've joined the WLAN, made sure my CameraUpload folder exists on the server. 
Taken a photo, waited one hour.
But no upload occurs.

title: Beta version destroys all settings
body:
I've joined the beta program, following the instructions in  README.md . I got stuck where it says "... end your final app will be replaced with the beta one." -- After waiting a while and reopening google play after reboot, nothing happened. Finally I uninstalled the app to get a chance for a re-install.
That works, I now have "Version 2.11.0-beta.1 release f280dd0a5" on my Samsung S4 with Adroid 5.0.1

The start screen asks me to enter a serve URL. 
All settings (3 server connections, camerasync, etc.) were lost.

I'd expect the beta version to pick up the settings of the normal version.

title: [BUG] Infinite loading when trying to connect with OAuth2
body:
### Actual behaviour
After enbabling OAuth2.0 plugin, It connects using an external browser. After I click on "Authorize", It goes back to the app with an infinite loading popup message "Requesting authorization..." (I'm not sure if it's the exact translation since my app is in French).

### Expected behaviour
Goes back to the app logged in
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable OAuth 2.0, Enable TOTP Second-factor Auth in server
2. Try to log in on the application


### Environment data
Android version: 9

Device model: OnePlus 5T

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 2.10.1

ownCloud server version: 10.0.10 (stable)

### Logs
No interesting logs
